page.title: 19THURLASTON CHURCH
page.content: The church was built in 1849. It was a school until 1919 when it was licensed for public worship.A church before this called St.Edmunds was licensed in 1360 A.D. It is a chapel of ease and part of the parish church of Dunchurch. It holds 120 people. The average is 20 people for communion and 30 on Sundays. For special events it has more. There is no graveyard. Babies are baptised in the church. Marriages are by special arrangement. There is a village fete in Church Lane and a ladies club which meets once a week. One lady in particular, regularly attends church and helps in many ways. We were shown sixties photographs when the fete was being held near the church.
